posts.name: Belle Isle Seafood
posts.note: Local seafood, including chowder and lobster rolls, in a spare, industrial space with inlet views. I ordered their fried Seafood Combo which had fried fish, shrimp, scallops, and I think clams along with French fries and cole slaw. No one can eat all the food you get by themselves. I'm glad I had help finishing it off.

posts.name: Blunch
posts.note: Breakfast and lunch counter turning out hearty pressed sandwiches and chocolate chip cookies until late.

posts.name: Maria's Pastry Shop
posts.note: Go for the pasta but more importantly for tennis ball sized meatballs.Unassuming Italian baker offering acclaimed sweets such as cannoli, torrone, and marzipan.

posts.name: Mike's Pastry
posts.note: Renowned Italian bake shop providing cannoli in multiple flavors, gelati, and biscotti since 1946. Mike's has some of the best cannoli I have ever had and they are huge.
posts.cptn: Chocolate mouse with chocolate chip cannoli and a ricotta cannoli from Mike!s Pastry in Boston's North End.

posts.name: Veggie Galaxy
posts.note: Imaginative twist on an old-school diner specializing in from-scratch vegan and vegetarian options. I ordered the Pearl Street Redhead Omelette (Portobellos, Caramelized Onion, Feta, Roasted Red Pepper Sauce) and don't forget to ask for their home-made hot sauce it's got the perfect amount of heat and spice for flavor.
